content.description: A sample of a gas is in a container with a movable piston that is initially locked in place. A single action is performed to take the gas from State <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> to State <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> by the process shown in the diagram.
content.question: Which of the following could be the single action performed?

choices.label: Gas molecules were removed from the container.
Energy was added to the gas by heating.
The piston was unlocked and pulled out.
The piston was unlocked and pushed in.

content.answer: Energy was added to the gas by heating.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
